description.narrative: The development objective is to prepare and respond to the COVID-19 pandemic in Liberia

condition.narrative: 1. Project Implementation Manual: The Recipient shall, not later than forty-five (45) days after the Effective Date, prepare andadopt a Project operations manual containing detailed guidelines and procedures for the implementation of the Project.
Per ESCP LMP shall be adopted, approved and disclosed within one months of the effectiveness of the AF
Per ESCP undertake the Institutional Capacity Assessment and Institutional Capacity Strengthening Plan within two months of theproject effectiveness date.
Per ESCP: Complete Fencing of National Reference Laboratory at Charlesville within one month of AF effectiveness
Per ESCP: Functional Workers GRM shall be established within two months of the effectiveness of AF and maintained throughout theProject implementation

Per ESCP: Making Incinerator and Ashpit functional at Jordanian Hospital in association with other nearby health facilities anddevelop a manual on the collection and transportation of waste from points of generation to the incineration site within one monthof AF effectiveness

Per ESCP: the National Guidelines for the Safe Management of Healthcare Waste in Liberia, updated in May 20, 2020, should updatedfor AF within one month of effectiveness; based on the outcome of review copies of National Guideline or revised National Guidelineshall be kept at all the facilities and its locations, and be known to all staffs within 15days of effectiveness.
Per ESCP" All related measures including SEA/H action plan shall be done accordingly and within one month of AF effectiveness andimplementation throughout the Project

Schedule 2, Section I E, 2 (a-c): The Recipient shall not later than sixty (60) days after the Effective Date:(a) recruit to thePIU a social safeguards officer with specific experience in GBV risk management, and terms of reference, experience, andqualifications, satisfactory to the Association.(b) operationalize the Project grievance redress mechanism (GRM), and thereafter,maintain throughout Project implementation, a functional GRM, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association; and(c) ensurethat National Guidelines for Safe Management of Health Care Waste have been distributed to the vaccination and other facilitieswhere such health waste is generated, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2, Section I,E,1: The Recipient shall not later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date update, adopt andre-disclose the (a) Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF); and (b) Gender-based Violence (GBV) Action Plan, all inform and substance satisfactory to the Association; and

title.narrative: Counties that have activated EOC inline with the national EOC activation as part of COVID-19 response
Counties with EOCs functioning according to standard operating procedures
EOC organized as part of COVID-19 response
Health centers reporting no stock-out of tracer IPC materials on the first day of each month
Prioritized facilities reporting supervisory visits on the first day of each month
Facilities with healthcare workers trained in COVID-19 emergency preparedness and other emergency response
Counties with pandemic preparedness and response plans per MOH guidelines
Point of entry that report having received a supervisory visit during the preceding month
At least one multi-sectoral simulation exercise conducted with results incorporated into national COVID-19 preparedness and response plans
Designated laboratories with COVID-19 diagnostic equipment, test kits, and reagents
Laboratories established/upgraded to support diagnosis of COVID-19 and other major infectious diseases
Laboratory staff trained to conduct COVID-19 diagnosis
Acute health care facilities with isolation capacities
Suspected cases of COVID-19 reported and investigated based on national guidelines, segregated by gender
Country has developed and operationalized a referral system to care for COVID-19 patients
Refurbished/upgraded health facilities implementing customer satisfaction survey
Facilities equipped (installation complete) with energy-efficient storage facilities for storing specimens and temperature sensitive medical supplies
AEFIs reported via the electronic notification system
Training of Project Implementation Unit (PIU) staff
National, subnational, facility-based and mobile staff trained in COVID-19 vaccine cold chain storage and handling (by gender)
Counties where radio stations broadcast awareness campaigns on COVID-19 and the COVID-19 vaccination campaign
Counties with budgeted micro-plans for COVID-19 vaccination campaign
Community engagement plan developed to increase the population's demand for the COVID-19 vaccine
Pharmacovigilance system adapted to detect AEFI following administration of the COVID-19 vaccine
Counties with at least two facilities providing COVID-19 vaccination services
Grievances addressed within the stipulated timeframe
Country has activated its Public Health Emergency Operations Center or a coordination mechanism for COVID-19
National, subnational, facility-based and mobile female staff trained in COVID-19 vaccine cold chain storage and handling
Suspected cases of COVID-19 in women reported and investigated based on national guidelines
Population completely vaccinated who are women
